title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ross@ecohealthallinace.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozillaâs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: A client for the dolt database
title: A client for the dolt database
text: doltr client dolt, SQL database git-like versioning. work progress, fully documented, API isnât fully baked yet.

title: A client for the dolt database
text: need dolt installed machine. Get . Install R package

title: A client for the dolt database
text: package provides two DBI-compliant drivers connect dolt database. dolt_remote() connects dolt server via TCP. dolt_local() connects local database directory. (Behind scenes dolt_local() launches manages background server process, can also done manually dolt_server()). dolt() serves connection cached R session connects via default parameters can defined via environment variables. (See ?config). dolt_pane() Provides RStudio connection pane showing database. variety dolt_* functions provide database information versioning capability. See help files dolt documentation.

title: A client for the dolt database
text: Please note dolt project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Find and check for the presence of a dolt binary. — is_dolt_installed
title: Find and check for the presence of a dolt binary. — is_dolt_installed
text: Find check presence dolt binary.

title: Find and check for the presence of a dolt binary. — is_dolt_installed
Configuration options — dolt-config
text: dolt package's behavior can modified setting environment variables.

title: Configuration options — dolt-config
text: DOLT_PORT sets port connect run server . Defaults 3306. - DOLT_HOST sets host IP connect run server . Defaults 127.0.0.1. DOLT_DIR set default directory look dolt database run server using dolt_local() dolt(). likely want set project-level .gitignore project contains database. Defaults "doltdb". DOLT_CONFIG_FILE path file additional configuration options dolt sql server. See https://docs.dolthub.com/interfaces/cli#dolt-sql-server options. - DOLT_PATH specifies path dolt binary running locally. Defaults one found system path. Running locally requires sys ps packages. DOLT_COLLECT specifies whether dolt convenience functions returning data return fully collected tibbles lazy tibbles processing. DOLT_SHOW_SQL print SQL statements executed running dolt convenience functions.

what: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: Examine information dolt tables diffs

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
code: dolt_diffs(table, to, conn = dolt(), collect = NULL, show_sql = NULL)  dolt_table_history(table, conn = dolt(), collect = NULL, show_sql = NULL)

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: table character name table database

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: commit compare

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: conn dolt database query

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: collect Whether return full results (TRUE) uncollected dplyr::tbl() processed dplyr pipelines collecting. Can set globally environment variable DOLT_COLLECT.

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: show_sql Whether print console SQL statement executed. Useful learning dolt SQL syntax.  Defaults false. Can set globally environment variable DOLT_SHOW_SQL.

text: remote name remote. "origin" used default

code: dolt_add(tables = NULL, conn = dolt(), collect = NULL, show_sql = NULL)  dolt_commit(   all = TRUE,   message = NULL,   author = NULL,   date = NULL,   allow_empty = FALSE,   conn = dolt(),   collect = NULL,   show_sql = NULL )  dolt_reset(   hard = FALSE,   tables = NULL,   conn = dolt(),   collect = NULL,   show_sql = NULL )  dolt_checkout(ref, b = FALSE, conn = dolt(), collect = NULL, show_sql = NULL)

what: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: dolt() returns connection default database. convenience wrapper around dbConnect(dolt_local/remote(), ... also caches connections faster loading.

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
code: dolt(   dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   dbname = NULL,   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   cache_connection = TRUE,   ... )

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: dir directory server dolt_local() connection. "remote" dolt_remote() connection made server started.

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: username username. Defaults "root"

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: password login password.  Defaults empty.

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: port TCP port connections. Defaults 3306.

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: host IP host. Defaults local machine, 127.0.0.1

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: cache_connection preserve cache connection? allows faster load times prevents connection garbage-collected.

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: ... arguments passed dolt_server() MariaDB()

Initiate a dolt database directory — dolt_init
text: dir path directory. created exist

what: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
text: dolt_local() creates DoltLocalDriver, can generate DoltLocalConnection.  Unlike dolt_remote() DoltDriver, version takes directory name -disk dolt database, starts manages dolt SQL server background serving directory, connects returns connection. Parameters govern server connection Multi-user , complicated networking set-ups use dolt_server() dolt_remote() directly.

title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
code: DBI::dbConnect(doltr::dolt_local(), ...)  # S4 method for DoltLocalDriver dbConnect(   drv,   dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   find_port = TRUE,   server_args = list(),   ... )

title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
text: drv object class DoltLocalDriver, created dolt_local().

title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local

what: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
title: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
text: dolt_remote() DBI Driver connect dolt server via port. , DoltDriver, DoltConnection class wrappers around around classes methods RMariaDB package. parameters can specified environment variables See config.

what: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: Start dolt SQL server return server process handle

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
code: dolt_server(   dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   find_port = TRUE,   multi_db = FALSE,   autocommit = TRUE,   read_only = FALSE,   log_level = "info",   log_out = FALSE,   timeout = 0,   query_parallelism = 2,   max_connections = 100,   config_file = Sys.getenv("DOLT_CONFIG_FILE", "") )

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: dir dolt directory serve

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: username username. Defaults "root"

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: password login password.  Defaults empty.

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: port TCP port connections. Defaults 3306.

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: host IP host. Defaults local machine, 127.0.0.1

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: find_port TRUE, switch different port port used another process

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: multi_db Serve multiple databases? TRUE, dir directory multiple subdirectories dolt databases

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: autocommit Automatically commit database changes working set? FALSE, anything manually committed lost.

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: read_only database allow read_only connections?

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: log_level Defines level logging provided. Options "trace", debug", "info", "warning", "error", "fatal" (default "info").

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: log_out logging output directed.  TRUE passed std_out(), FALSE (default), suppressed.  Can also take filename, connection, callback function.  See sys::exec().

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: timeout Defines timeout, seconds, used connections value 0 represents infinite timeout (default 28800000)

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: query_parallelism Set number go routines spawned handle query (default 2)

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: max_connections Set number connections handled server (default 100)

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: config_file path YAML config file set additional server configuration values.  See options dolt documentation.

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: dolt_server object also ps::ps_handle()

what: doltr: A client for the dolt database — doltr-package
title: doltr: A client for the dolt database — doltr-package
text: Creates DBI-compliant interface dolt databases (<https://www.dolthub.com>). Also manages local dolt server processes, provides convenience functions dolt versioning, RStudio connection pane interface.

title: doltr: A client for the dolt database — doltr-package
text: Maintainer: Noam Ross noam.ross@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: EcoHealth Alliance [copyright holder]
